#Text=George Forster ( murderer )
#Text=For other people named George Forster , see George Forster ( disambiguation ) .
#Text=George Forster ( or Foster ) was found guilty of murdering his wife and child by drowning them in Paddington Canal , London .
#Text=He was hanged at Newgate on 18 January 1803 , shortly after which his body was taken to a nearby house where it was used in an experiment by Italian scientist Giovanni Aldini . [ 1 ]
#Text=At his trial the events were reconstructed .
#Text=Forster 's mother-in-law recounted that her daughter and grandchild had left her house to see Forster at 4 p.m. on Saturday , 4 December 1802 .
#Text=Joseph Bradfield , in whose house Forster lodged , reported that they had stayed together that night and gone out at 10 a.m. on the Sunday morning .
#Text=He also stated that Forster and his wife had not been on good terms because she wished to live with him .
#Text=Various witnesses saw Forster with his wife and child in public houses near Paddington Canal during the day on the Sunday .
#Text=The body of his child was found on the Monday morning ; after the canal was dragged for three days , his wife 's body was also found . [ 1 ]

#Text=Forster claimed that upon leaving The Mitre he set out alone for Barnet in order to see his other two children who were in the workhouse there , though he was forced to turn back at Whetstone due to the failing light .
#Text=This was contradicted by a waiter at The Mitre who said the three left the inn together .
#Text=Scepticism was also expressed that he could have walked to Whetstone in the time he claimed .
#Text=The jury found him guilty .
#Text=He was sentenced to death and also to be dissected thereafter .

#Text=This sentence was designed not only to provide medicine with corpses on which to experiment , but also to ensure that the condemned could not rise on Judgement Day , their bodies having been cut into pieces and selectively discarded .
#Text=Forster was hanged on 18 January , shortly before which he made a full confession .
#Text=He said he had come to hate his wife and had twice before taken his wife to the canal but his nerve had both times failed him . [ 1 ]
#Text=A recent BBC Knowledge documentary ( Real Horror : Frankenstein ) questions the fairness of the trial .
#Text=It notes that friends of George Forster 's wife later claimed that she was extremely suicidal and had often talked about killing herself and her daughter .
#Text=According to this documentary , Forster attempted suicide by stabbing himself with a crudely fashioned knife .
#Text=This was to avoid awakening during the dissection of his body , should he not have died when hanged .
#Text=This was a real possibility owing to the crude methods of execution at the time .
#Text=The same reference suggests that his ' confession ' was obtained under duress .
#Text=In fact , it alleges that Pass , a Beadle on Aldini 's payroll , fast-tracked the whole trial and legal procedure in order to obtain the freshest corpse possible for his benefactor .
#Text=An illustration of a galvanised corpse
#Text=After the execution
#Text=Forster 's body was given to Giovanni Aldini for experimentation .
#Text=Aldini was the nephew of fellow scientist Luigi Galvani and an enthusiastic proponent of his uncle 's method of stimulating muscles with electric current , known as Galvanism . [ 2 ]
#Text=The experiment he performed on Forster 's body was a demonstration of this technique .

#Text=The Newgate Calendar ( a record of executions at Newgate ) reports that , " On the first application of the process to the face , the jaws of the deceased criminal began to quiver , and the adjoining muscles were horribly contorted , and one eye was actually opened .

#Text=Several of those present believed that Forster was being brought back to life ( The Newgate Calendar reports that even if this had been so , he would have been re-executed since his sentence was to  hang until he be dead " ) and one man , Mr Pass , the beadle of the Surgeons ' Company , was so shocked that he died shortly after leaving . [ 1 ]

column1: #Text=The hanged man was certainly dead , since his blood had been drained and his spinal cord severed after the execution .
#Text=Media
#Text=The Galvanism experiment performed on George Forster was explored in the Science Channel 's Dark Matters : Twisted But True .
#Text=George Forster was noted on History Channel show called , Zombies : A Living History
